about_the_game:
It's way harder than it looks. But just as weird.

Get ready to face the surreal challenge of controlling a disembodied arm called Derechín, using only the buttons and movement of your mouse. Immerse yourself in the desert campaign of the 1880s War of the Pacific from this one-of-a-kind point of view!



Move and physically interact with different types of objects and characters to complete the chapters of Derechín's extravagant story! And if you want, you can go back to them and try to complete them in the least amount of time you can possibly take! Do you have what it takes to reach the top of the leaderboard? (Yes, this is a desperate call to the speedrunner community)

Not THAT weird controls


Even though the default controls aren't quite as normal as some would like, they were designed this way for a very special reason: you should be able to control every finger using the same finger in real life, and also be able to extend and contract the arm doing the same with yours!

Take the least amount of time possible!


For the "not quite normal people" crowd, Arm Around! has a built-in online leader board system which keeps track of every record on every chapter. Best your friend's time to show off or even get to the top of the world-wide leader board to earn a well deserved (and very exclusive) achievement.



Long live the arm!

Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: i3 9100F or Ryzen 3 4100
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1050

short_description: You are literally an arm. Yes, seriously, you'll literally have to try to control a disembodied arm. How? Well just use the buttons and movement of your mouse! Move and physically interact with objects and characters to... wait, what kind of a mission could a disembodied arm possibly have?
